column1: 1887;"A. O. Scott";"A. O. Scott";"full-time";"A. O. Scott joined The New York Times as a film critic in January 2000
column2: and was named a chief critic in 2004. Previously
column3: Mr. Scott had been the lead Sunday book reviewer for Newsday and a frequent contributor to Slate
column4: The New York Review of Books

column1: In the 1990s he served on the editorial staffs of Lingua Franca and The New York Review of Books. He also edited ""A Bolt from the Blue and Other Essays
column3: which was published by The New York Review of Books in 2002.

column1: Mr. Scott was a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize in Criticism in 2010
column2: the same year he served as co-host (with Michael Phillips of the Chicago Tribune) on the last season of ""At the Movies
column3: the syndicated film-reviewing program started by Roger Ebert and Gene Siskel.

column1: A frequent presence on radio and television
column2: Mr. Scott is Distinguished Professor of Film Criticism at Wesleyan University and the author of Better Living Through Criticism
column3: forthcoming in 2016 from The Penguin Press. A collection of his film writing will be published by Penguin in 2017.

column1: He lives in Brooklyn with his family.";"";627

column1: 1959;"Stephen Holden";"Stephen Holden";"full-time";"Stephen Holden is a film and music critic for The Times; he joined the culture staff in 1988. Prior to that
column2: he was a pop music critic and journalist for Rolling Stone
column4: and numerous other magazines and anthologies. Drawing on his experiences as a journalist and record executive
column5: he wrote a satirical novel about the record business
column7: that was published in 1980 by Dell Books. In 1986
column8: he won a Grammy with six other writers for Best Album Notes for ""The Voice: The Columbia Years
column9: a Frank Sinatra Anthology."" Born July 18
column11: Mr. Holden graduated from Yale University in 1963 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in English and was elected Class Poet.";"";628
